definition-item.definition-title: STRUCTURAL ELEMENTS; BUILDING MATERIALS (for bridges E01D; specially designed for insulation or other protection E04B; elements used as building aids E04G; for mining E21; for tunnels E21D; structural elements with broader range of application than for building engineering F16, particularly F16S)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Structural elongated elements for buildings, prefabricated or not, as individual structural elements per se, e.g. pillars, columns, beams, girders, trusses;
Two-dimensional prefabricated building elements for the construction of parts of buildings, like sheets, slabs or panels, mainly for walls or partitions;
Apparatus for handling smaller elements or hardenable material for the realization of two-dimensional concrete or stone-like prefabricated elements;
Bricks or block shaped elements, but only if having special adaptations, like e.g. serving for locating conduits, or being transparent, or being built-up from parts of different materials;
Concrete reinforcements, of metal or other materials, e.g. rebars, stirrups, reinforcing grids or cages, reinforcing fibres, connectors and spacers for reinforcements
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Compositions of concrete, mortars or like building materials
Structural elements for bridges
Building foundations
Structural elements specially designed for insulation or other protection
Building construction in general
Load-bearing walls made from panels
Load- and non-load-bearing walls made up of layers of building elements, e.g. brick walls; bricks or block shaped building elements for walls
Other load-bearing walls
Other non-load-bearing walls; Curtain walls
Floor structures
Roof structures
Suspended or false ceilings
Roof coverings
Finishing work on building, e.g. lining, covering, flooring
Panels for lining or finishing
Elements used as building aids, e.g. scaffolding, forms
Buildings or like structures for particular purposes, e.g. small temporary buildings, waiting shelters, telephone cabinets
Structural elements for mining
Structural elements for tunnels
Structural elements with broader range of application than for building engineering

definition-item.definition-title: Building elements of block or other shape for the construction of parts of buildings (of relatively thin form E04C2/00; structural elongated elements designed for load-supporting E04C3/00, e.g. columns or pillars E04C3/30; manufacture or material of building bricks, stones, or the like B28, C03, C04; paving elements E01C; general building constructions E04B, e.g. walls E04B2/00, floors E04B5/00, roofs E04B7/00, ceilings E04B9/00; {roof coverings E04D; coverings for walls or ceilings E04F13/00; floorings E04F15/00;} structural elements specially designed for built-in conduit shafts E04F17/00; {elements for buildings for particular purposes E04H7/00}; special elements for building ovens or furnaces F24B, F27D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Bricks or block shaped elements for the construction of parts of buildings, but only if having special adaptations, like e.g. serving for locating conduits, or being made-up of different materials, e.g. stones with insulating inserts, or being made-up of transparent materials, e.g. glass bricks
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of relatively thin form, e.g. panels
Structural elongated elements designed for load-supporting, e.g. beams, column or pillars

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture or material of building bricks, stones, or the like
Shaping clay or other ceramic composition, producing shaped articles of clay composition
Paving elements
General building constructions
Walls
Floor structures
Roof structures
Suspended ceilings
Roof coverings
Coverings for walls or ceilings
Floorings
Structural elements specially designed for built-in conduit shafts
Elements for buildings for particular purposes
Special elements for building ovens or furnaces
F24B, F27D

section-body.paragraph-text: Building elements of block or other shape are classified in E04C1/00 - E04C1/42 only if they are characterised by special adaptations, if they are build-up from parts of different materials or if they are made of glass or other translucent material; general building elements of block or brick shape for walls are classified in E04B2/00; general building elements of block or other shape for floors, e.g. filling elements, are classified in E04B5/00.

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by special adaptations, e.g. serving for locating conduits, for forming soffits, cornices, or shelves, for fixing wall-plates or door-frames, for claustra

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Walls having cavities in the building elements
Special adaptation of floors for incorporating ducts
Wall copings
Soffits coverings for roof cornices

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Claustra
Open-work wall

definition-item.definition-title: {for ventilating, heating or cooling}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building elements of block or other shape having openings or adaptations of relatively large section for ventilating, heating or cooling.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of block or other shape having openings or adaptations of relatively small section for locating conduits
Domestic or space heating systems
Air conditioning
Ventilation in general

definition-item.definition-title: {for claustra, fences, planting walls, e.g. sound-absorbing (pots for vertical horticulture A01G9/022)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pots for vertical horticulture

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sound barriers
Retaining or protecting walls, made up of similar modular elements stacked without mortar
Fences

definition-item.definition-title: {serving for locating conduits (E04C1/392 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building elements of block or other shape having openings or adaptations of relatively small section for locating conduits
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of block or other shape having openings or adaptations of relatively large section for ventilating, heating or cooling.

definition-item.definition-title: of glass or other transparent material {(panels made of glass bricks E04C2/546)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slab-like translucent elements made of glass bricks

definition-item.definition-title: Building elements of relatively thin form for the construction of parts of buildings, e.g. sheet materials, slabs, or panels (materials or manufacture, see the relevant subclasses, e.g. B27N, D21J; made in situ E04B; specially designed for insulation or other protection E04B1/62; load-carrying floor structures E04B5/02, E04B5/16; roofs consisting of self-supporting slabs E04B7/20; roof or like covering elements E04D3/00; for lining or finishing E04F13/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Two-dimensional prefabricated building elements for the construction of parts of buildings, i.e. building elements in which one dimension is small in comparison to the other two, like e.g. sheets, slabs or panels, mainly used for walls or partitions
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of relatively thin form made in situ
Load-carrying floor structures, e.g. load-carrying prefabricated floor slabs
Roof or like slab shaped covering elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Manufacture by dry processes of articles, made from particles or fibres of wood
Shaping clay or other ceramic composition, producing shaped articles of clay composition
Manufacture of articles from cellulosic fibrous suspension
Building elements of relatively thin form specially designed for insulation or other protection
Roof consisting of self-supporting slabs
Slabs or panels for suspended ceilings
Building elements for lining or finishing

section-body.paragraph-text: For the materials or the manufacture, see the relevant subclasses.
Classify in E04C2/00 - E04C2002/3494 all additional information

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by specified materials (translucent E04C2/54)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slab-like translucent elements

definition-item.definition-title: of concrete or other stone-like material; of asbestos cement; {of cement and other mineral fibres} (E04C2/26 takes precedence; material or manufacture B28, C04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/04, E04C2/08, E04C2/10, or of materials covered by one of these groups with a material not specified in one of these groups

section-body.paragraph-text: For the material or the manufacture, see B28, C04.

definition-item.definition-title: {Apparatus for handling the smaller elements or the hardenable material; bricklaying machines for prefabricated panels (bricklaying machines in general E04G21/22)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Bricklaying machines in general

definition-item.definition-title: {of plaster (E04C2/049 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of an insulating material on plaster basis, like foamed plaster
Furniture panels with a continuous layer allowing folding
Folding plates or sheets by forming folding lines and folding
Panels for suspended ceilings

definition-item.definition-title: {of concrete (E04C2/049 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of an insulating material on concrete basis, like cellular concrete
Walls made by projecting concrete to the exterior of an insulating foam panel

definition-item.definition-title: reinforced

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building sheets, slabs or panels made of concrete or other stone-like materials and reinforcing elements, e.g. slabs of concrete with reinforcing rods
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing elements, e.g. for concrete

definition-item.definition-title: of metal, e.g. sheet metal (E04C2/26 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/04, E04C2/08, E04C2/10, or of materials covered by one of these groups with a material not specified in one of these groups

definition-item.definition-title: of wood, fibres, chips, vegetable stems, or the like; of plastics; of foamed products ({E04C2/049}, E04C2/26 take precedence; {hydraulic cement and mineral fibres E04C2/04})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of hydraulic cement and mineral fibres
Building sheets, slabs or panels made of foamed concrete or other stone-like products

Building sheets, slabs or panels composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/04, E04C2/08, E04C2/10, or of materials covered by one of these groups with a material not specified in one of these groups

definition-item.definition-title: of solid wood

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building sheets, slabs or panels substantially made of solid wood, with or without reinforcements
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of fibres, chips, vegetable stems or the like
Building sheets, slabs or panels laminated and composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/12, E04C2/16, E04C2/20

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels laminated and composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/12, E04C2/16, E04C2/20
Wood working

definition-item.definition-title: reinforced

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforced wooden beams

definition-item.definition-title: of fibres, chips, vegetable stems, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building sheets, slabs or panels composed of organic or inorganic fibres, organic or inorganic chips, vegetable stems, or the like, with or without additional glue or adhesive
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of hydraulic cement and mineral fibres

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels laminated and composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/12, E04C2/16, E04C2/20

definition-item.definition-title: with binding wires, reinforcing bars, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing elements, e.g. for concrete

definition-item.definition-title: of plastics

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels laminated and composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/12, E04C2/16, E04C2/20
Shaping of plastics

definition-item.definition-title: reinforced {(E04C2/205 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building sheets, slabs or panels made of plastics and comprising reinforcing elements such as fibres, rods
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of foamed plastics
Reinforcing elements, e.g. for concrete

definition-item.definition-title: laminated and composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/12, E04C2/16, E04C2/20

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layered products

definition-item.definition-title: composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/04, E04C2/08, E04C2/10 or of materials covered by one of these groups with a material not specified in one of the groups {(of cement and mineral fibres E04C2/04)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Building sheets, slabs or panels, laminated or not, and composed of materials covered by two or more of groups E04C2/04, E04C2/08, E04C2/10 or of materials covered by one of these groups with a material not specified in one of the groups.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels made of hydraulic cement and mineral fibres

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Layered products

definition-item.definition-title: composed of insulating material and concrete, stone or stone-like material

section-body.paragraph-text: Sandwich panels composed of layers of insulating material alternated with layers of concrete are classified in E04C2/288.

definition-item.definition-title: composed of insulating material and non-metallic or unspecified sheet-material (E04C2/288 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels composed of insulating material and concrete, stone or stone-like material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Fibrous panels characterised by the orientation of the fibres

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by the shape or structure (translucent E04C2/54)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slab-like translucent elements

definition-item.definition-title: formed of corrugated or otherwise indented sheet-like material; composed of such layers with or without layers of flat sheet-like material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Corrugated metal floor slabs for floors
Roofing slabs having special cross-sections
Roofing slabs comprising two or more layers, with or without corrugations

section-body.paragraph-text: Corrugated sheet-like material having one as well as a plurality of layers is classified in E04C2/32

definition-item.definition-title: {with parallel corrugations}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sheet-like material with parallel corrugations, e.g. with parallel undulated corrugations

definition-item.definition-title: {with incisions or reliefs in the surface (E04C2/326 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of relatively thin form with corrugations, incisions or reliefs in more than one direction of the element

definition-item.definition-title: {with corrugations, incisions or reliefs in more than one direction of the element}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sheet-like material with corrugations, incisions or reliefs in more than one direction of the element, e.g. egg-crate reliefs

definition-item.definition-title: composed of two or more spaced sheet-like parts (E04C2/32 takes precedence; spacers for cavity walls E04B2/44)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sheet-like elements composed of two or more spaced sheet-like parts, e.g. sandwich panels
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Panels composed of insulating material and concrete
Building elements of relatively thin form formed of corrugated or otherwise indented sheet-material
Spacers for cavity walls
Roofing slabs comprising two or more layers

definition-item.definition-title: {spaced apart by profiled spacer sheets}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sheet-like elements composed of two or more spaced sheet-like parts, spaced apart by profiled spacer sheets, like e.g. corrugated cardboard

definition-item.definition-title: spaced apart by transversely-placed strip material, e.g. honeycomb panels (honeycomb or other core members for layered products B32B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Honeycomb or other core members for layered products

definition-item.definition-title: with attached ribs, flanges, or the like, e.g. framed panels (concerned with attaching to other panels or elements to form a structure, see the places for the relevant structure, e.g. E04B2/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building sheets, slabs or panels having attached ribs, flanges, or the like, e.g. framed panels and panels with upstanding edges around their borders
Details of connection to other panels or elements to form a structure are classified in the groups of the relevant structure, e.g. E04B2/00 for wall structures
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Framed panel
Panel having a frame around its borders

definition-item.definition-title: composed of a number of smaller components rigidly or movably connected together, e.g. interlocking, hingedly connected {of particular shape, e.g. not rectangular of variable shape or size, e.g. flexible or telescopic panels (E04C2/041 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Building sheets, slabs or panels, composed of a number of smaller components rigidly or movably connected together, e.g. foldable garage doors
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building sheets, slabs or panels, composed of a number of smaller components rigidly connected together, of concrete or other stone-like material, of asbestos cement, of cement and other mineral fibres

definition-item.definition-title: Gratings; Grid-like panels (reinforcing elements E04C5/00; built-in gratings E04F19/10; gratings in general F16S3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing grids or mats of metal
Non-metallic reinforcing mats
Grids for ceilings
Built-in gratings
Gratings or grilles made from a sheet
Gratings in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Grids, gratings for stable floors
Making metal grids
Circumferential gutters for swimming-pools

definition-item.definition-title: with special adaptations for auxiliary purposes, e.g. serving for locating conduits (E04C2/54 takes precedence; block-shaped elements therefor E04C1/39; floor structures incorporating ducts E04B5/48)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Slab-like translucent elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of block shape having adaptations serving for locating conduits
Floor structures incorporating ducts

definition-item.definition-title: {for ventilating}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ventilation in general

definition-item.definition-title: {for heating or cooling (solar heat collectors F24S10/00; heat storage F28D20/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Solar heat collectors
Heat storage

definition-item.definition-title: Slab-like translucent elements (floors for transmitting light E04B5/46; translucent or open-work ceilings E04B9/32, E04B9/34; translucent roof coverings E04D3/06, E04D3/28)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Translucent or transparent slab-like elements
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Floors for transmitting light
Translucent ceilings, open work ceilings
Translucent roof coverings

definition-item.definition-title: {Hollow multi-walled panels with integrated webs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Translucent hollow slab-like elements having a cross-section which is internally subdivided by walls, e.g. a translucent polyurethane roofing slab which cross section is internally subdivided by, in use, horizontal and vertical walls
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Greenhouse of flexible material with double or multiple walls
Extrusion dies for extruding multi-channel profiles
Translucent roof covering made with elements having special cross-sections

definition-item.definition-title: Structural elongated elements designed for load-supporting (as building aids E04G)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Structural elongated elements designed for permanent load-supporting in buildings, e.g. building beams and columns
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Structural elongated elements for bridges
Piles for foundations
Non-load supporting elongated members for partition walls
Non-load supporting elongated elements for suspended ceilings
Structural elongated elements designed as building aids
Structural elongated elements for masts, towers, poles
Structural elongated elements for tents
Structural elongated elements for mining, tunnels
E21C, E21D

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Structural elongated elements for railways or railway vehicles, for land vehicles, for ships, for aircrafts
Structural elongated elements for hoisting devices, e.g. cranes
Structures comprising elongated load-supporting parts; three-dimensional framework structures
Connections of bar shaped building elements; for metal bars; for wooden bars

section-body.paragraph-text: Classify in E04C3/00 - E04C2003/0495 all additional information

definition-item.definition-title: {Girders or columns that are rollable, collapsible or otherwise adjustable in length or height (girders as supporting members for forms E04G11/54)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Structures characterised by movable, separable, or collapsible parts
Locating rails for walls, with adjustable curvature
Extensible girders as supporting members for forms; telescopic
Telescopic shores or struts
Telescopic grandstands; foldable, retractable tribunes
Telescopic poles
Inflatable tubular frameworks for tents
Collapsible frames for tents; telescopic
Extensible carriers for electric cables

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Girders or columns that are rollable
Girders or columns that are coilable or windable

definition-item.definition-title: Joists; Girders, trusses, or trusslike structures, e.g. prefabricated; Lintels; Transoms; {Braces} (E04C3/38 takes precedence; for structures characterised by movable, separable, or collapsible parts E04B1/343; {braced purlins E04B7/024})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arched girders or portal frames
Roof structures having braced purlins

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cross-sectional aspects of beams, girders and joists made of metal
Reinforcing elements consisting of light-weight girders as reinforcing elements, e.g. light-weight girders for floors construction
Girders for cranes
Structures characterised by movable, separable, or collapsible parts
Connections of bar shaped building elements
Constructional features of the supporting construction of suspended-ceilings, e.g. inverted T-bars
Girders for shutterings

section-body.paragraph-text: Structures characterised by movable, separable, or collapsible parts should be classified in E04B1/343; when these structures have elongated structural elements presenting inventive aspects they can also be classified in E04C3/02 or its sub-groups.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joist
Horizontal supporting member that runs from wall to wall, wall to beam, or beam to beam to support a ceiling, a roof or a floor.
Girder
Support beam used in construction, e.g. an I-shaped girder, a box-shaped girder, a truss- or lattice-girder.
Truss
Elongated structure comprising one or more triangular units constructed with straight members whose ends are connected at joints referred as nodes.
Lintel
Load-bearing elongated element located in use over door or window openings.
Transom
A bar of wood or stone across the top of a door or window opening
Brace
A structural elongated element serving as connecting/reinforcing element between structural elements, e.g. braces between wooden joists in a floor structure

definition-item.definition-title: of metal (E04C3/29 takes precedence; as reinforcing elements E04C5/06; manufacture B21)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of different material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cross-sectional aspects of beams, girders and joists made of metal
Metallic girder or trusses used as reinforcing elements
Manufacture of metallic elongated elements; Rolling of metal
Structures of metal for towers, masts or poles

section-body.paragraph-text: Metallic girders or trusses used as reinforcing elements should be classified in E04C3/04 and its sub-groups only if they have some inventive aspects and can be used as load-supporting elements per se.

definition-item.definition-title: with substantially solid, i.e. unapertured, web (E04C3/10, E04C3/11 take precedence {honeycomb girders E04C3/083})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Honeycomb metallic beams, i.e. castellated beams; metallic beams with apertured solid web
Metallic joists, girders and trusses with non-parallel upper and lower edges

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cross-sectional aspects of beams, girders and joists made of metal
Prestressed metallic joists, girders and trusses

section-body.paragraph-text: Metallic girders having a web constituted by a series of unapertured webs having a spacing between them, i.e. like a rake, are classified in E04C3/06 and in E04C3/083.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: web

The "vertical" element of the beam connected to the flange(s); the beam can either be an I-, T-,C- or a box beam; in case of an H or U-beam the web is considered to be the "horizontal" element (in analogy with I- and C-beams.)

definition-item.definition-title: at least partly of bent or otherwise deformed strip- or sheet-like material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Metallic girders or beams having a non-apertured web and made at least partially of deformed strip- or sheet-like material, e.g. by cold rolling
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lintels
Braces
Cross-sectional aspects of beams, girders and joists made of metal
Metallic girders or beams made of bent or otherwise deformed strip- or sheet-like material, and having an apertured web
Bending of sheet metal
Wall partitions with framework or posts of metal
Supporting beams for a suspended ceiling having a folded cross-section

definition-item.definition-title: with apertured web, e.g. with a web consisting of bar-like components; Honeycomb girders (E04C3/10, E04C3/11 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic joists, girders and trusses with non-parallel upper and lower edges
Metallic arched girders or trusses, portal frames

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic truss-like structures composed of separate truss elements
Prestressed metallic joists, girders and trusses
Reinforcing elements consisting of metallic light-weight girders, e.g. light-weight girders for floor construction
Truss-type bridges
Three-dimensional frameworks
Connections specially adapted for structures comprising elongated supporting parts of metal
Metallic truss-like structures for masts, towers, poles

definition-item.definition-title: {Honeycomb girders; Girders with apertured solid web}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Honeycomb metallic girders, i.e. castellated metallic girders; Metallic girders with apertured solid web, i.e. metallic girders in which apertures have been made in the solid web.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic girders or beams made of bent or otherwise deformed strip- or sheet-like material, and having an apertured web

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making rigid structural elements or units, e.g. honeycomb structures

section-body.paragraph-text: Metallic girders having a web constituted by a series of unapertured webs having a spacing between them, i.e. like a rake, are classified in E04C3/06 and in E04C3/083.

table-column.paragraph-text: Honeycomb girder
Castellated girder

definition-item.definition-title: at least partly of bent or otherwise deformed strip- or sheet-like material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Metallic girders or beams made of at least partially deformed strip- or sheet-like material, and having an apertured web, e.g. made by an expanded metal sheet or made by cutting holes in the solid web.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic girders or beams made of at least partially deformed strip- or sheet-like material, and having a substantially unapertured web
Bending of sheet metal
Wall partitions with framework or posts of metal
Supporting beams for a suspended ceiling having a folded cross-section

section-body.paragraph-text: Metallic trusses made of bar-like elements consisting of bent or deformed sheet material, the bar-like elements per se having an unapertured web, should be classified in E04C3/08 and in E04C3/07, not in E04C3/09.

definition-item.definition-title: prestressed

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Members specially adapted to be used in prestressed constructions

definition-item.definition-title: with non-parallel upper and lower edges, e.g. roof trusses (arched girders, portal frames E04C3/38)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic arched girders, portal frames

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connections specially adapted for structures comprising elongated supporting parts of metal
Roofs consisting of a plurality of parallel similar trusses

definition-item.definition-title: of wood, e.g. with reinforcements, with tensioning members (E04C3/292 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses made of wood and metal

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wood working
Wall partitions with framework or posts of wood

definition-item.definition-title: with substantially solid, i.e. unapertured, web ({E04C3/127,} E04C3/17, E04C3/18 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses with non-parallel upper and lower edges, e.g. roof trusses
Joists, girders or trusses made of wood with metal or other reinforcements or tensioning members

section-body.paragraph-text: Wooden girders having a web constituted by a series of unapertured webs having a spacing between them, i.e. like a rake, are classified in E04C3/14 and in E04C3/16.

definition-item.definition-title: with apertured web, e.g. trusses (E04C3/17, E04C3/18 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders, or trusses with non-parallel upper and lower edges, e.g. roof trusses
Wooden arched girders, portal frames

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses made of wood with metal or other reinforcements or tensioning members
Three-dimensional framework structures
Connections specially adapted for structures comprising elongated supporting parts of wood
Wooden truss-like structures for masts, towers and poles

section-body.paragraph-text: Wooden girders having a web constituted by a series of unapertured webs having a spacing between them, i.e. like a rake, are classified in E04C3/14 and in E04C3/16.

definition-item.definition-title: with non-parallel upper and lower edges, e.g. roof trusses

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wooden arched girders, portal frames

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wood working
Connections specially adapted for structures comprising elongated supporting parts of wood
Roof consisting of a plurality of parallel similar trusses

definition-item.definition-title: with metal {or other} reinforcements or tensioning members

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforced panels of solid wood
Joists, girders or trusses made of wood and metal
Members specially adapted to be used in prestressed constructions

definition-item.definition-title: {Synthetic reinforcements}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing elements of material other than metal

definition-item.definition-title: of concrete or other stone-like material, e.g. with reinforcements or tensioning members (reinforcing elements E04C5/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of steel and parts of concrete
Reinforcing elements

definition-item.definition-title: {with apertured web, e.g. frameworks, trusses (E04C3/26 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Prestressed joints, girders or trusses made of concrete or other stone-like material

definition-item.definition-title: built-up by elements jointed in line

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Concrete beams built-up by elements jointed in-line, e.g. made up of stacked elements
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Prestressed joints, girders or trusses made of concrete or other stone-like material

definition-item.definition-title: prestressed (E04C3/22, E04C3/29 take precedence; prestressing members E04C5/08)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses made of concrete or other stone-like material, and built-up by elements jointed in line

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of steel and parts of concrete
Members specially adapted to be used in prestressed constructions

definition-item.definition-title: of materials not covered by groups E04C3/04 - E04C3/20

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Joists, girders or trusses made of specified materials other than metal, wood. concrete or stone-like materials, e.g. joists made of glass or plastics
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of different materials, e.g. laminated from parts of different materials
Producing beams of plastics

definition-item.definition-title: built-up from parts of different material, {i.e. composite structures}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of specified different materials, e.g. built-up from laminated parts of different materials, or from assembled parts of different materials
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shaping composites
Producing beams of plastics
Layered products
Superstructures of vehicles characterised by the materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Wooden or concrete beams having reinforcements should primarily be classified in E04C3/18, E04C3/185 respectively E04C3/20-E04C3/26; when the reinforcements represent a substantial part of the cross-section of the beam, or are themselves constituting a beam, the composite wooden or concrete beams with these reinforcing elements can also be classified in E04C3/29
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Composite structure
Composite structure refers to the structure of the assembly of the different parts, not to the material

definition-item.definition-title: the materials being wood and metal

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wooden joists, girders or trusses with metal reinforcements or tensioning members

definition-item.definition-title: the materials being steel and concrete (concrete with internal reinforcements or tensioning members E04C3/20)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses made of concrete with internal reinforcements or tensioning members
Metallic beams forming part of a floor structure

definition-item.definition-title: of concrete combined with a girder-like structure extending laterally outside the element (light weight girders used as reinforcement E04C5/065; as part of a floor structure E04B5/23)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Girders or trusses built-up from a concrete element and a steel girder-like structure extending laterally outside the concrete element
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Light weight girders with concrete precast parts, used as reinforcement
Metallic beams forming part of a floor structure, and extending below the floor

definition-item.definition-title: Columns; Pillars; Struts (not designed for end loading E04C3/02; posts, masts, as independent structures E04H12/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Structural elongated elements not designed for end loading
Elongated supporting members for partition walls
Structural elongated elements designed as building aids
Posts, masts as independent structures
Structural elongated elements for tents
Poles for tents

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coverings or linings for columns

definition-item.definition-title: of metal (E04C3/36 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Girders made of metal
Cross-sectional aspects of beams, girders and joists made of metal

section-body.paragraph-text: Always classify in E04C3/32 columns or pillars in which at least a bearing part of the column or pillar is made of metal, with the exception of concrete rebars

definition-item.definition-title: of concrete other stone-like material, with or without permanent form elements, with or without internal or external reinforcement, e.g. metal coverings (E04C3/36 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closed reinforcement cages composed of one single bent reinforcement mat
Closed reinforcement cages with spiral- or coil-shaped stirrup rod

section-body.paragraph-text: Always classify in E04C3/34 columns or pillars in which at least a bearing part of the column or pillar is made of concrete or stone-like material

definition-item.definition-title: of materials not covered by groups E04C3/32 or E04C3/34; of a combination of two or more materials

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Columns, pillars or struts made of specified materials other than metal or concrete or stone-like materials, e.g. wood, glass, plastics
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses made of materials other than metal, wood. concrete or stone-like materials, e.g. joists made of glass or plastics
Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of different materials, e.g. laminated from parts of different materials

definition-item.definition-title: Arched girders or portal frames (straight girders able to be bent E04C3/02; inflatable E04H15/20)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Straight girders able to be bent
Inflatable girders or portal frames

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Gantries or semi-gantries, a.k.a. road sign holders
Arched structures
Vaulted roofs
Arched-type supports for tents

definition-item.definition-title: of metal (E04C3/46 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic girders
Cross-sectional aspects of beams, girders and joists made of metal
Metallic trusses
Mechanical metal-working
Connections specially adapted for structures comprising elongated supporting parts of metal

section-body.paragraph-text: Always classify in E04C3/40 if a bearing part of the arched girder or portal frame is made of metal

definition-item.definition-title: of wood, e.g. units for rafter roofs (E04C3/46 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Wooden girders
Wooden trusses
Working of wood
Connections specially adapted for structures comprising elongated supporting parts of wood

section-body.paragraph-text: Always classify in E04C3/42 if a bearing part of the arched girder or portal frame is made of wood

definition-item.definition-title: of concrete or other stone-like material, e.g. with reinforcements or tensioning members (E04C3/46 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing elements

section-body.paragraph-text: Always classify in E04C3/44 if a bearing part of the arched girder or portal frame is made of concrete or other stone-like material

definition-item.definition-title: of materials not covered by groups E04C3/40 - E04C3/44; of a combination of two or more materials

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Arched girders or portal frames made of specified materials other than metal, wood, concrete or stone-like material, e.g. of glass, plastics
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Joists, girders or trusses made of materials other than metal, wood. concrete or stone-like materials, e.g. joists made of glass or plastics
Joists, girders or trusses built-up from parts of different materials, e.g. laminated from parts of different materials

definition-item.definition-title: Reinforcing elements, e.g. for concrete; Auxiliary elements therefor ({methods or devices for making reinforcing materials B21D;} material composition {C04B,} C21, C22)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reinforcing elements, metallic and non-metallic, in particular for concrete;
Auxiliary elements for reinforcements, e.g. connectors, spacers;
Arrangements of reinforcing elements, e.g. stirrup baskets
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Methods or devices for making metallic reinforcing materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Material composition

definition-item.definition-title: Reinforcing elements of metal, e.g. with non-structural coatings {(E04C5/08 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Members specially adapted to be used in prestressed constructions

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanical metal-working
Working or processing of metallic wire

definition-item.definition-title: {Discrete reinforcing elements, e.g. fibres}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Discrete reinforcing elements of metal, i.e. suitable to be mixed with the concrete before pouring, e.g. metal fibres
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Filler material of fibre shape for concrete

section-body.paragraph-text: Discrete reinforcing elements of metal with a well-defined shape other than granular are classified in E04C5/012 ; discrete elements of metal of granular shape or the shape of which is not defined are considered filler elements and are only classified in C04B

definition-item.definition-title: {Anti-corrosion coatings or treating compositions, e.g. containing waterglass or based on another metal (coating of discrete reinforcing elements C04B20/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Reinforcing elements of metal including anti-corrosion coatings or treating compositions or in-situ anti-corrosion treatments, e.g. cathodic protection
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coating of discrete metallic reinforcing elements, e.g. coating of metallic fibres

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Inhibiting corrosion of metallic material by applying inhibitors to the surface in danger

definition-item.definition-title: {Anti-corrosion coatings or treating compositions containing cement}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mortars containing hydraulic cement
Coating compositions based on cement

definition-item.definition-title: of low bending resistance

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Anchoring devices specially adapted for balconies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Masonry wall-ties, e.g. anchors
Reinforcing elements for brick walls, inserted between brick layers

definition-item.definition-title: with indentations, projections, ribs, or the like, for augmenting the adherence to the concrete

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rolling or cold-forming of concrete metallic reinforcement bars
Bending of reinforcing metallic rods for concrete

definition-item.definition-title: Mats ({combined with reinforcing elements protruding out of the plane of the mat E04C5/0627; three-dimensional mats E04C5/0636}; bases for plaster E04F13/04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Metallic reinforcing mats
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic reinforcing mats combined with reinforcing elements protruding out of the plane of the mat
Three-dimensional metallic reinforcing mats
Bases for plaster

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making metallic wire nets

definition-item.definition-title: of high bending resistance, i.e. of essentially three-dimensional extent, e.g. lattice girders {(anchorage devices specially adapted for balconies E04B1/0038; supporting devices for connector reinforcing rods for concrete walls E04G21/125)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Anchorage devices specially adapted for balconies
Supporting devices for connector reinforcing rods for concrete walls, e.g. reinforcement connection boxes

section-body.paragraph-text: Loose closed stirrups suitable to make prismatic or cylindrical reinforcement cages are classified in E04C5/0604.
Loose open stirrups suitable to make stirrup baskets are classified in E04C5/0622.

definition-item.definition-title: {Prismatic or cylindrical reinforcement cages composed of longitudinal bars and open or closed stirrup rods (E04C5/0631 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing mats combined with separate prefabricated reinforcement cages or girders

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making wire network of tubular form, e.g. as reinforcement for pipes or pillars
Making wire network of tubular form by attaching individual stirrups to longitudinal wires

section-body.paragraph-text: Loose closed stirrups suitable to make prismatic or cylindrical reinforcement cages are classified in E04C5/0604.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: open stirrup rod
Rebar bent in an open loop
closed stirrup rod
Rebar bent in a closed loop

definition-item.definition-title: {Closed cages composed of two or more coacting cage parts, e.g. transversally hinged or nested parts}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making wire network of tubular form by bending preformed mesh

definition-item.definition-title: {Closed cages made of one single bent reinforcement mat}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making wire network of tubular form by bending preformed mesh

definition-item.definition-title: {Closed cages with spiral- or coil-shaped stirrup rod}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Columns or pillars made of concrete
Making wire network of tubular form by attaching continuous stirrup to longitudinal wires, by rotation
Prefabricated foundation piles of reinforced concrete
Concrete foundation piles cast in situ

definition-item.definition-title: {Open cages, e.g. connecting stirrup baskets (E04C5/0609 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Closed cages composed of two or more co-acting cage parts

section-body.paragraph-text: Loose stirrups suitable to make stirrup baskets are classified in E04C5/0622.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: stirrup basket
a substantially U-shaped channel like basket made of a series of parallel open stirrups positioned one after the other and linked by at least one longitudinal rebar

definition-item.definition-title: {Three-dimensional reinforcements composed of a prefabricated reinforcing mat combined with reinforcing elements protruding out of the plane of the mat (E04C5/0645 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shear reinforcements
Making of plaster-carrying wire network

definition-item.definition-title: {Reinforcing mats combined with separate prefabricated reinforcement cages or girders (E04C5/064 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Three-dimensional reinforcing mats composed of two parallel mats connected by separate connecting parts

section-body.paragraph-text: E04C5/064 takes precedence
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: girder
a light-weight metallic girder that can also be used as concrete reinforcement

definition-item.definition-title: {Three-dimensional reinforcing mats composed of reinforcing elements laying in two or more parallel planes and connected by separate reinforcing parts (E04C5/0645 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shear reinforcements

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: separate reinforcing parts
parts that are not connected to the reinforcing elements before being connected to them

definition-item.definition-title: {the reinforcing elements in each plane being formed by, or forming a, mat of longitunal and transverse bars}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Making wire networks of three-dimensional form by connecting wire networks

definition-item.definition-title: {Shear reinforcements, e.g. shearheads for floor slabs}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Metallic reinforcements specially adapted for shear reinforcement, e.g. shearheads for floor slabs, shear baskets, shear spiral reinforcements, shear studs,
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Floor structures of extraordinary design

definition-item.definition-title: Light-weight girders, e.g. with precast parts (light-weight girders in general E04C3/08, E04C3/294)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Light-weight girders, e.g. with precast concrete, like the pre-fabricated light-weight girders for floor construction
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metallic girders with apertured web
Girders made of concrete combined with a girder-like structure extending laterally outside the element

definition-item.definition-title: Reinforcing elements of material other than metal, e.g. of glass, of plastics, or not exclusively made of metal (metal elements with non-structural coatings E04C5/01)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Metal elements with non-structural coatings
Anchoring devices specially adapted for balconies

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Reinforcing elements for brick walls, inserted between brick layers
Increasing or restoring the load-bearing capacity of building construction elements

definition-item.definition-title: {Discrete reinforcing elements, e.g. fibres}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Non entirely metallic discrete reinforcing elements, i.e. suitable to be mixed with the concrete before pouring, e.g. glass or carbon fibres
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Filler material of fibre shape for concrete

section-body.paragraph-text: Non entirely metallic discrete reinforcing elements with a well-defined shape other than granular are classified in E04C5/073 ; non entirely metallic discrete elements of granular shape or the shape of which is not defined are considered filler elements and are only classified in C04B

definition-item.definition-title: Members specially adapted to be used in prestressed constructions {(production of reinforced objects in general B28B23/00; prestressed structures produced in situ E04G21/12)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Members specially adapted to be used in prestressed constructions, e.g. prestressing tendons and cables, ducts, anchoring devices.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tensioning of moulded or shaped articles, at the factory
Tools or methods for in situ tensioning

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Anchors; Connections of cables to bridge parts
Suspension cables for bridges
Increasing or restoring the load-bearing capacity of building construction elements

definition-item.definition-title: Ducts

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rigid pipes wound from sheets or strips of metal

definition-item.definition-title: Anchoring devices (tools or methods for tensioning {in situ} E04G21/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools or methods for tensioning in situ

definition-item.definition-title: {the tensile members are anchored by wedge-action}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Construction of stressing jacks

definition-item.definition-title: {the tensile members are profiled to ensure the anchorage, e.g. when provided with screw-thread, bulges, corrugations}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coaxial connection of reinforcement bars by means of sleeves
Making helical shapes on metallic bodies
Ground anchors
Anchoring bolts for galleries

definition-item.definition-title: Auxiliary parts for reinforcements, e.g. connectors, spacers, stirrups ({E04C5/06 takes precedence;} tools connecting reinforcing elements E04G21/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Auxiliary parts for reinforcements, e.g. connectors and spacers
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Tools for connecting reinforcing elements
Supporting devices for connector reinforcing rods for concrete walls, e.g. reinforcement connection boxes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connecting stirrup baskets

section-body.paragraph-text: Loose closed stirrups suitable to make prismatic or cylindrical reinforcement cages are classified in E04C5/0604.
Loose open stirrups suitable to make stirrup baskets are classified in E04C5/0622.

definition-item.definition-title: {Connectors or means for connecting parts for reinforcements (E04C5/168 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for joining reinforcing bars

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spacers connecting parts for reinforcement and spacing the reinforcements from the form

definition-item.definition-title: {the reinforcements running in one single direction}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Connectors connecting reinforcements running in one single direction, either coaxially or only parallel to one another

definition-item.definition-title: {Coaxial connection by means of sleeves}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Connections wire to wire by soldering or welding with additional connecting elements or material
Making helical shapes on metallic bodies
Connections using screw-thread elements for coaxial connections of two rods

definition-item.definition-title: {the reinforcements running in different directions}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines for joining reinforcing bars

definition-item.definition-title: {Connection by means of clips or other resilient elements}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Connection by means of clips or other resilient material of reinforcements running in different directions
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Clamping or clipping connections for rods forming a crossed-over connection

definition-item.definition-title: {Spacers connecting parts for reinforcements and spacing the reinforcements from the form}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Spacers connecting parts for reinforcement together, and spacing the reinforcements from the form
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Substantially metallic spacers
Non substantially metallic spacers

definition-item.definition-title: {Spacers} of metal or substantially of metal {(E04C5/168 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Metallic or substantially metallic spacers spacing the reinforcements from the form or spacing the reinforcements from one another, e.g. spacers between two reinforcing grids (upper and lower) in a floor structure
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spacers connecting parts for reinforcements and spacing the reinforcements from the form

definition-item.definition-title: of material other than metal or with only additional metal parts, e.g. concrete or plastics spacers with metal binding wires {(E04C5/168 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Spacers of material other than metal or with only additional metal parts, e.g. concrete or plastics spacers with metal binding wires, spacing the reinforcements from the form or spacing the reinforcements from one another, e.g. spacers between two reinforcing grids (upper and lower) in a floor structure
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Spacers connecting parts for reinforcements and spacing the reinforcements from the form
